help.title: Help & FAQ
help.subtitle: Answers to common questions about MVGA Wallet.
help.faq1a: MVGA (Make Venezuela Great Again) is a community-owned digital dollar platform for Venezuelans. It provides zero-fee remittances, savings, P2P trading, and humanitarian grants — all powered by Solana.
help.faq2a: Share your wallet address or QR code with the sender. They can send SOL, USDC, USDT, or MVGA tokens directly. Funds arrive in seconds with minimal fees on Solana.
help.faq3a: Stake your MVGA tokens to earn rewards. Choose a lock period for higher APY — 30-day, 90-day, or 180-day locks earn 1.5x, 2x, or 3x rewards respectively. Flexible staking has no lock.
help.faq4q: How do I use P2P trading?
help.faq4a: Go to P2P Exchange to buy or sell crypto with Zelle, Venmo, PayPal, or bank transfer. Trades use an escrow system — crypto is locked until both parties confirm the fiat payment.
help.faq5q: How do I create a grant proposal?
help.faq5a: Navigate to Grants and tap 'Propose'. You need staked MVGA to create a proposal. Describe your Venezuelan business, set a funding amount, and the community votes with their staked tokens.
help.faq6a: MVGA charges a small fee on swaps and P2P trades. 100% of fees go back to the community: staking rewards, liquidity, humanitarian grants, and token burns. Zero goes to founders.
help.faq7q: How do I create a wallet?
help.faq7a: Tap 'Create New Wallet' on the welcome screen. Set a strong password, then carefully write down your 12-word recovery phrase on paper. This phrase is the only way to recover your funds.
help.faq8a: Your recovery phrase is 12 words that act as the master key to your wallet. Write them on paper and store safely. Never share them. If you lose this phrase and your password, your funds are gone forever.
help.faq9q: How do I set up biometrics?
help.faq9a: After creating your wallet, you can enable Face ID, Touch ID, or fingerprint unlock. This lets you sign in without typing your password each time. Your password is still needed as a backup.
help.faq10q: How do I set up my profile?
help.faq10a: During onboarding or in Settings, you can add a display name, email, and username. You also get a unique Ciudadano Digital number that identifies you in the MVGA community.
help.faq11a: Go to Deposit and choose your method: card or bank transfer via Onramper, PayPal, or buy USDC with bolivars via Pago Movil. You can also receive crypto directly to your wallet address.
help.faq12a: On the Deposit page, select the PayPal tab. Connect your PayPal account and deposit USD which converts to USDC in your wallet. Fee: 2.99% + $0.49.
help.faq13q: How do I buy USDC with bolivars?
help.faq13a: Go to 'Deposit Bolivars' to browse LP offers. Select an offer, enter the VES amount, and send payment via Pago Movil. Once the LP confirms receipt, USDC is released from escrow to your wallet.
help.faq14a: Tap Send, enter the recipient's Solana address or scan their QR code. Choose the token and amount, review the preview, and confirm. Transactions settle in seconds on Solana.
help.faq15a: Tap 'Scan & Pay' to open your camera. Scan any Solana Pay QR code or wallet address QR. The app auto-fills the recipient and amount for you to review and confirm.
help.faq16q: Can I send to multiple people at once?
help.faq16a: Yes! Go to Batch Send to send to up to 15 recipients in one transaction. Add addresses and amounts, review the total, and confirm. Great for payroll or group payments.
help.faq17a: When a P2P trade starts, the seller's crypto is locked in an on-chain Solana escrow program — not held by MVGA. Once the buyer confirms fiat payment and the seller verifies receipt, escrow releases the crypto. If there's a dispute, MVGA admin reviews evidence and resolves it.
help.faq18q: What if there's a P2P dispute?
help.faq18a: If a trade goes wrong, either party can open a dispute. Provide evidence (screenshots of payment, bank confirmations). MVGA admin reviews and either releases funds to the buyer or refunds the seller. Crypto stays in escrow until resolved.
help.faq19q: What payment methods are supported for P2P?
help.faq19a: Zelle, Venmo, PayPal, Bank Transfer, Pago Movil, and Binance Pay. Both parties agree on a method before the trade. Fiat transfers happen off-chain between buyer and seller.
help.faq20q: How do I get a card?
help.faq20a: Go to Banking > Card. Complete KYC verification first, then request your virtual card. Use it for online purchases or add to Apple Pay / Google Pay for contactless payments.
help.faq21q: What is KYC and why do I need it?
help.faq21a: KYC (Know Your Customer) is identity verification required for the card, cash-out, and MoneyGram features. Upload your ID through the Persona verification flow. P2P trading does NOT require KYC.
help.faq22q: Can I use Apple Pay or Google Pay?
help.faq22a: Yes! Once your card is issued, you can add it to Apple Pay or Google Pay for contactless payments at any store that accepts tap-to-pay.
help.faq23a: Go to Banking > Savings to deposit USDC into a yield-generating position powered by Kamino on Solana. Your USDC earns variable APY from DeFi lending markets. Withdraw anytime.
help.faq24q: What are the risks of DeFi features?
help.faq24a: DeFi features (savings, staking) use smart contracts that carry inherent risks: potential bugs, market volatility, and variable returns. MVGA is self-custodial — we cannot reverse transactions or recover lost funds. Only deposit what you can afford to risk.
help.faq25q: How do I cash out to dollars?
help.faq25a: Go to Cash Out and choose: Airtm (USDC to your Airtm wallet, then withdraw to local methods), P2P sell (trade crypto for fiat via 6 payment methods), or gift cards (spend via Bitrefill).
help.faq26q: How does MoneyGram cash out work?
help.faq26a: MoneyGram lets you convert USDC to cash pickable at 350,000+ locations in 170+ countries. Start the process in Cash Out > MoneyGram, follow the steps, and pick up cash at a nearby location.
help.faq27a: Yes! Go to Gift Cards to browse Netflix, Spotify, Amazon, Steam, and more from Bitrefill. Pay with your USDC balance and receive the gift card code instantly.
help.faq28a: Self-custodial means YOU control your private keys and funds. MVGA never has access to your wallet. We cannot freeze accounts, reverse transactions, or recover lost passwords. Your keys, your responsibility.
help.faq29q: I lost my password. What do I do?
help.faq29a: If you have your 12-word recovery phrase, you can restore your wallet on any device. If you lost both your password AND recovery phrase, your funds are permanently inaccessible. MVGA cannot help recover them — this is how self-custody works.
help.faq30a: Go to Top-Up, select your Venezuelan carrier (Movistar, Movilnet, or Digitel), enter the phone number and amount. Pay with your USDC balance. The top-up is applied instantly.
